A range from one SI unit to the next

Author:
Joris Borgdorff

Constructor Detail

SIRange

public SIRange(SIUnit min,
               SIUnit max)
Construct a range with a minimum and maximum. If either min or max is null, they will be interpreted as negative and positive infinity respectively.

Parameters:
min - minimum or null
max - maximum or null
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if both min and max are null, or if min is larger than max.

SIRange

public SIRange(SIUnit value)
Method Detail

isDefinite

public boolean isDefinite()
Whether the minimum and maximum of the range are both set values

getMinimum

public SIUnit getMinimum()
Minimum value of the range. If null is returned, interpret as negative infinity.

getMaximum

public SIUnit getMaximum()
Maximum value of the range If null is returned, interpret as positive infinity.

isPoint

public boolean isPoint()
Whether the range is in fact a single point or value

getMean

public SIUnit getMean()
The mean value between the minimum and maximum. Returns null if either the minimum or maximum is null

contains

public boolean contains(SIRange range)
Whether the given range is a full subset of this range
